intro: Fernelia pedunculata, commonly known as the mountain fernalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white, with a distinctive three-lobed structure, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Fernelia pedunculata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with cool climates.
